citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
The facility is not preparing complete reports of its semi-annual evaluations or submitting the report to the Institutional
Official (IO) every 6 months. The facility held an IACUC meeting on 1 May 2024 during which they completed the required
semi-annual review of the facility’s program for humane care and use of animals and the animal facility inspection but did
not submit the official report to the IO until 18 November 2024. The facility next held an IACUC meeting on 15 October
2024 during which they completed the required semi-annual review of the facility’s program for humane care and use of
animals and the animal facility inspection but did not submit the official report to the IO until 21 March 2025. The reports
that were submitted to the IO and reviewed during this inspection were not signed by a majority of the IACUC.
The purpose of such reports are to inform the IO of the facility’s adherence to title 9, chapter I subchapter A- Animal
Welfare including any departures identified by the IACUC; facility issues that the IO can help resolve; and if any
significant/major problems are identified and not corrected in time, the IO will be required to report in writing to USDA the
failure to adhere to the plan and schedule for correction of significant deficiencies.
The IACUC shall prepare evaluation reports at least once every six months upon completion of the required semiannual
evaluations which are reviewed and signed by a majority of the IACUC members. The report must identify all deficiencies,
designate each as significant or minor and contain a reasonable and specific plan and schedule with dates for correcting
each deficiency.
Correct by 30 October 2025 or by the next facility semi-annual evaluation.

citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
The IACUC approved protocol Veterinary Surgical Nursing and Assisting Laboratory (VT 1600) did not provide a written
narrative description of the methods and sources used to determine that alternatives were not available to a procedure
that may cause more than momentary pain or distress to the animals that is included in the protocol (spay, neuter).
Per this Section, whenever a proposal for animal use contains procedures that may cause more than momentary pain or
distress to the animals, the IACUC shall determine that: (1) the principal investigator has considered alternatives to those
procedures and (2) that the principal investigator has provided a written narrative description of the methods and sources
used to determine that alternatives were not available. These requirements ensure that all procedures contained in the
protocol minimize discomfort, distress, and pain to the animals.
Correct by 10 August 2025

citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
The 5 IACUC approved protocols actively being used at the facility do not contain a written assurance by the principal
investigator that the animal use activities do not unnecessarily duplicate previous experiments.
Per this Section, the IACUC shall determine during the review of proposed animal use activities or significant changes in
ongoing activities that the principal investigator has provided written assurance that the activities do not unnecessarily
duplicate previous experiments. This requirement ensures that the animals under study do not experience research
activities that are unnecessarily duplicative. The IACUC needs to address this deficiency for the protocols and needs to
ensure that all approved protocols contain a written assurance regarding unnecessary duplication.
Correct by 10 August 2025.

citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
The 5 IACUC approved protocols actively being used at the facility did not include a rationale for the appropriateness of
the species of animals to be used. An animal use proposal must include an adequate rationale for the appropriateness of
the species of animals to be used so that the IACUC can conduct a thorough review of the components of the activities
related to the care and use of animals and determine that the proposed activities are appropriate for the species being
used. Correct by ensuring that all protocols contain all components listed in this subsection.
Correct by 10 August 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.31(c)(3) 
   
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC). 
The facility is not preparing complete reports of its semi-annual evaluations or submitting the report to the Institutional 
Official (IO) every 6 months. The facility held an IACUC meeting on 1 May 2024 during which they completed the required 
semi-annual review of the facility’s program for humane care and use of animals and the animal facility inspection but did 
not submit the official report to the IO until 18 November 2024. The facility next held an IACUC meeting on 15 October 
2024 during which they completed the required semi-annual review of the facility’s program for humane care and use of 
animals and the animal facility inspection but did not submit the official report to the IO until 21 March 2025. The reports 
that were submitted to the IO and reviewed during this inspection were not signed by a majority of the IACUC.  
 
The purpose of such reports are to inform the IO of the facility’s adherence to title 9, chapter I subchapter A- Animal 
Welfare including any departures identified by the IACUC; facility issues that the IO can help resolve; and if any 
significant/major problems are identified and not corrected in time, the IO will be required to report in writing to USDA the 
failure to adhere to the plan and schedule for correction of significant deficiencies. 
The IACUC shall prepare evaluation reports at least once every six months upon completion of the required semiannual 
evaluations which are reviewed and signed by a majority of the IACUC members. The report must identify all deficiencies, 
designate each as significant or minor and contain a reasonable and specific plan and schedule with dates for correcting 
each deficiency.  
Correct by 30 October 2025 or by the next facility semi-annual evaluation. 
2.31(d)(1)(ii) 
   
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC). 
The IACUC approved protocol Veterinary Surgical Nursing and Assisting Laboratory (VT 1600) did not provide a written 
narrative description of the methods and sources used to determine that alternatives were not available to a procedure 
that may cause more than momentary pain or distress to the animals that is included in the protocol (spay, neuter). 
 
Per this Section, whenever a proposal for animal use contains procedures that may cause more than momentary pain or 
distress to the animals, the IACUC shall determine that: (1) the principal investigator has considered alternatives to those 
procedures and (2) that the principal investigator has provided a written narrative description of the methods and sources 
used to determine that alternatives were not available. These requirements ensure that all procedures contained in the

protocol minimize discomfort, distress, and pain to the animals. 
Correct by 10 August 2025 
2.31(d)(1)(iii) 
   
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC). 
The 5 IACUC approved protocols actively being used at the facility do not contain a written assurance by the principal 
investigator that the animal use activities do not unnecessarily duplicate previous experiments. 
 
Per this Section, the IACUC shall determine during the review of proposed animal use activities or significant changes in 
ongoing activities that the principal investigator has provided written assurance that the activities do not unnecessarily 
duplicate previous experiments. This requirement ensures that the animals under study do not experience research 
activities that are unnecessarily duplicative. The IACUC needs to address this deficiency for the protocols and needs to 
ensure that all approved protocols contain a written assurance regarding unnecessary duplication.  
Correct by 10 August 2025. 
2.31(e)(2) 
   
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC). 
The 5 IACUC approved protocols actively being used at the facility did not include a rationale for the appropriateness of 
the species of animals to be used. An animal use proposal must include an adequate rationale for the appropriateness of 
the species of animals to be used so that the IACUC can conduct a thorough review of the components of the activities 
related to the care and use of animals and determine that the proposed activities are appropriate for the species being 
used. Correct by ensuring that all protocols contain all components listed in this subsection.  
Correct by 10 August 2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
